intro: Aroton, commonly known as the golden bell, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its distinctive, pendulous yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, round fruits that mature to a dark brown color. Aroton thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant flowers and drought tolerance.
